item.title: China Tensions Prompt U.S. Navy Race to Reload Missiles at Sea
item.description: A U.S. destroyer can fire dozens of cruise missiles within minutes, but reloading back in port can take two months. In a war against China, that could be a fatal weakness.

item.title: Russian and Syrian Regime Forces Strike Rebel-Held Territory as Assad Faces Biggest Threat in Years
item.description: Airstrikes aim to weaken supply lines feeding a resurgent Islamist rebel movement.

item.title: On Brief Stop in U.S., Taiwan President Sends Signal to Both China and Trump
item.description: In Hawaii, Lai Ching-te indicated Taipei isn’t seeking war with China, even as it counts on U.S. support to deter Beijing.

item.title: A Top Mission for Europe's Chief Is to Cool Trump's Ire Toward the EU
item.description: Donald Trump is threatening Europe over trade and war. What comes next will depend partly on Ursula von der Leyen.

item.title: How a Young Chinese Nationalist Turned Her Back on Beijing
item.description: Studying overseas, a former “little pink” started questioning her patriotic education.

item.title: How the Killing of a Rabbi in Dubai Upended a Community That Thought It Was Safe
item.description: The United Arab Emirates had been seen as a relatively secure place for growing the numbers of Jews moving there. Until Rabbi Zvi Kogan disappeared.

item.title: China Is Studying Russia's Sanctions Evasion to Prepare for Taiwan Conflict
item.description: An interagency group set up in the wake of the Ukraine invasion has been reporting back to Beijing with lessons it can use in case of war and Western penalties.

item.title: Taiwan's President Begins Hawaii Stopover Despite China's Protests
item.description: Lai Ching-te is facing the challenge of strengthening ties with the U.S. during a time of transition in Washington.

item.title: Rebel Forcesin Syria Take Most ofAleppo in Surprise Offensive
item.description: Syria’s antigovernment forces claimed a stunning advance into Aleppo, in a setback for the government in Damascus and its allies Russia and Iran.

item.title: Reopening Gaza's Rafah Crossing Is on the Table in Fresh Cease-Fire Push
item.description: Hamas officials are expected to discuss the new proposal in Cairo on Saturday. The militant group has shown greater flexibility since the Lebanon truce deal.

item.title: Setbacks for Russia, Iran and Hezbollah Turn Into a Catastrophe for Syria's Assad
item.description: The loss of Aleppo to Islamist rebels represents a stunning defeat for the Syrian regime, highlighting its dependence on enfeebled allies.

item.title: Tracking a Year of Dangerous Tit for Tat on the Korean Border
item.description: See how a series of actions by Kim Jong Un’s regime has shaken up the world’s most militarized border.

item.title: After U.S.-China Prisoner Swap, Scores of Americans Are Still Trapped in China
item.description: The plight of Americans facing exit bans in China shows the enduring risks of getting caught in the country’s murky legal system.

item.title: The Whiz Kid Who Made Billions for Yale Is Rethinking His China Strategy
item.description: Lei Zhang helped university endowments and foundations make big returns in his native country, then the U.S. soured on China.

item.title: China's Factory Activity Grows Narrowly in November
item.description: An official gauge of China’s manufacturing activity edged up, marking its second consecutive month of expansion after Beijing moved to stabilize economic growth.

item.title: At Israel's Northern Border, Caution and Fear Despite Hezbollah Truce
item.description: Many residents remain wary of returning to their homes near the border with Lebanon after this week’s cease-fire.

item.title: U.K. Lawmakers Approve Medically Assisted Suicide
item.description: The bill gives people the right to assisted suicide if they have a terminal illness and fewer than six months to live.

item.title: Kiki Håkansson, the First Winner of the Miss World Beauty Pageant, Dies at 95
item.description: A Swede, Håkansson was crowned in 1951. Nearly three decades later, she was living in Utah, working at a Fotomat kiosk.

item.title: U.K. Spy Chief Urges U.S. Not to Abandon Ukraine
item.description: Richard Moore, head of MI6, makes veiled plea to President-elect Donald Trump as peace talks loom.

item.title: Key Western Counterterrorism Ally in Africa Cuts Military Ties With France
item.description: Chad is the latest country in the troubled Sahel region to break with its former colonial power, a move that will likely result in the exit of some 1,000 French troops.
